item.title: 罢工仍在继续，美国零售商寻求备用运输计划，为假期做好准备
item.description: 随着美国东海岸和墨西哥湾沿岸港口罢工的持续，从李维斯-施特劳斯（Levi Strauss）到好市多（Costco）等大型零售商都在准备替代运输计划，以确保货物能及时运抵假日旺季。【原文：Major retailers from Levi Strauss to Costco are preparing alternative shipping plans to ensure goods arrive in time for the peak holiday season as the U.S. East Coast and Gulf Coast ports strike drags on.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，在线零售商 Shein 即将在伦敦上市前举行路演
item.description: 三位知情人士透露，Shein 将在未来几周内为其伦敦首次公开募股（IPO）计划举行非正式投资者会议，在等待英国监管机构批准的同时推进准备工作。【原文：Shein is set to hold informal investor meetings in the coming weeks for its planned London initial public offering (IPO), three sources with knowledge of the matter said, pushing ahead with preparations as it awaits UK regulatory approval.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，特斯拉计划在 2026 年推出四款新电池，其中包括用于机器人出租车的电池
item.description: 据《信息报》周四援引知情人士的话报道，特斯拉计划设计四种新型内部电池，为其即将推出的机器人出租车 Cybertruck 和其他电动汽车提供动力。【原文：Tesla plans to design four new versions of its in-house battery to power the Cybertruck, its forthcoming robotaxi and other electric vehicles, the Information reported on Thursday, citing people with knowledge of its plans.】

item.title: 独家报道竞争对手浏览器称微软在 Edge 上的做法不公平，应遵守欧盟技术规则
item.description: 三款竞争对手浏览器和一批网络开发商在致欧盟委员会的一封信中说，微软的 Edge 网络浏览器具有不公平的优势，欧盟反垄断监管机构应该对其实施严厉的欧盟技术规则。【原文：Microsoft gives its Edge web browser an unfair advantage and EU antitrust regulators should subject it to tough EU tech rules, three rival browsers and a group of web developers said in a letter to the European Commission.】

item.title: 2024 年假日购物销售额预测
item.description: 美国零售商正在为今年比往年更短的假期购物窗口做准备，注重价格的购物者将重点放在 "黑色星期五 "和 "网络星期一 "等重要活动前后的优惠和促销活动上。【原文：U.S. retailers are gearing up for a shorter-than-usual holiday shopping window this year, with price-conscious shoppers focused on deals and promotions around key events such as Black Friday and Cyber Monday.】

item.title: 李维-施特劳斯（Levi Strauss）股价因假日季度业绩预期疲软而下跌
item.description: 李维-施特劳斯公司周四股价下跌约 7%，此前该公司对假日季度收入的预测不温不火，凸显了这家牛仔布生产商在零售商需求低迷、消费者消费疲软的情况下所面临的困境。【原文：Levi Strauss' shares fell about 7% on Thursday after a tepid forecast for holiday-quarter revenue underscored the denim maker's struggles with sluggish demand from retailers navigating weak spending by consumers.】

item.title: 美国 8 月份工厂订单意外下降
item.description: 8 月份，美国制成品的新订单出人意料地减少，而企业的设备支出似乎在第三季度有所回落。【原文：New orders for U.S.-manufactured goods unexpectedly fell in August, while business spending on equipment appears to have pulled back in the third quarter.】

item.title: 瑞典工会就劳资冲突对特斯拉提起诉讼
item.description: 瑞典工会官员周四表示，瑞典工会 IF Metall 已对特斯拉提起诉讼，指控该公司未将工作场所的变动情况告知员工代表，而根据瑞典劳动法，这是必须履行的义务。【原文：Swedish trade union IF Metall has filed a lawsuit against Tesla alleging the company failed to inform employee representatives of workplace changes, which is mandatory under the country's labour laws, union officials said on Thursday.】

item.title: OpenAI 设立 40 亿美元信贷机制
item.description: OpenAI 周四表示，除了该人工智能初创公司周三公布的 66 亿美元投资外，它还与摩根大通、花旗、高盛、摩根士丹利、桑坦德、富国银行、SMBC、瑞银和汇丰银行建立了新的 40 亿美元信贷机制。【原文：OpenAI said on Thursday it has established a new $4 billion credit facility with JPMorgan Chase, Citi, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Santander, Wells Fargo, SMBC, UBS, and HSBC, in addition to the $6.6 billion investment the AI startup unveiled on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国服务业活动加速增长，创 1 年半新高；就业人数下降
item.description: 在新订单强劲增长的带动下，美国服务业活动在 9 月份跃升至 1 年半以来的新高，这进一步证明了第三季度经济依然保持稳健。【原文：U.S. services sector activity jumped to a 1-1/2-year high in September amid strong growth in new orders, more evidence that the economy remained on a solid footing in the third quarter.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Blackstone 寻求在新的亚洲 PE 基金中募集至少 100 亿美元，重点投资印度
item.description: 两位知情人士称，全球最大的另类资产管理公司黑石集团（Blackstone Inc）已开始募集其第三只专注于亚洲的私募股权（PE）基金，目标是至少 100 亿美元。【原文：Blackstone Inc , the world's largest alternative asset manager, has started raising its third Asia-focused private equity (PE) fund, targeting at least $10 billion, two people with knowledge of the situation said.】

item.title: 英美资源集团首席执行官称，公司解体后不会坐以待毙
item.description: 英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc）首席执行官邓肯-万布拉德（Duncan Wanblad）周四表示，英美资源集团在拆分钻石、铂金、镍和煤炭资产后，不会成为 "不可避免的 "收购目标。【原文：Anglo American Plc will not be an "inevitable" takeover target after its unbundles its diamond, platinum, nickel and coal assets, CEO Duncan Wanblad said on Thursday.】

item.title: 伯克希尔抛售更多美国银行股票
item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）本周抛售了更多的美国银行股票，自 7 月中旬以来销售额已增至近 100 亿美元，因为沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）简化了其企业集团庞大投资组合的一部分。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway unloaded more Bank of America stock this week, boosting sales since mid-July to nearly $10 billion as Warren Buffett simplifies part of his conglomerate's vast portfolio.】

item.title: 优步（Uber）与 Avride 合作，提供食品配送和机器人出租车服务
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies）周四表示，它正在与自动驾驶技术初创公司 Avride 合作提供食品配送和机器人出租车服务，这家打车公司正在迅速扩大其自动驾驶技术合作伙伴网络。【原文：Uber Technologies said on Thursday it was partnering with autonomous technology startup Avride for food deliveries and robotaxi services, as the ride-hail major rapidly extends its network of self-driving technology partners.】

item.title: 啤酒需求强劲，星座品牌季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 科罗娜（Corona）啤酒制造商星座品牌公司（Constellation Brands）周四公布的第二季度业绩超出预期，原因是其畅销啤酒品牌的强劲需求帮助减轻了葡萄酒和烈酒业务下滑带来的冲击。【原文：Corona beer maker Constellation Brands beat second-quarter results estimates on Thursday, as robust demand for its popular beer brands helped soften the hit from a slump in its wines and spirits business.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数温和上升
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数量略有上升，但飓风海伦在美国东南部的肆虐以及波音公司和港口的罢工可能会在短期内扭曲劳动力市场的状况。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits rose marginally last week, but Hurricane Helene's rampage in the U.S. Southeast and strikes at Boeing and ports could distort the labor market picture in the near term.】

item.title: 西班牙橄榄油受美国港口罢工影响，看不到替代路线
item.description: 世界最大的橄榄油生产国西班牙的橄榄油出口商警告说，在美国东海岸和墨西哥湾沿岸港口罢工的情况下，没有通往利润丰厚的美国市场的可行替代路线。【原文：Olive oil exporters in Spain, the world's biggest producer, have warned there are no viable alternative routes to the lucrative U.S market amid a strike at U.S. East and Gulf Coast ports.】

item.title: 李维-施特劳斯股价下跌，因预计假日季度业绩低迷
item.description: 李维-斯特劳斯公司（Levi Strauss）周四在盘前交易中股价大跌约 11%，因为该公司预测假日季度收入不佳，这家牛仔布生产商正努力应对零售商需求疲软、消费者减少消费的局面。【原文：Levi Strauss' shares slumped about 11% in premarket trading on Thursday after it forecast tepid holiday quarter revenue as the denim maker grapples with weak demand from retailers with consumers paring back spending.】

item.title: 埃克森公司与杰罗姆港炼油厂工会达成协议，允许继续实施裁员计划
item.description: 能源巨头埃克森美孚公司发言人周四表示，在本周与工会达成多数协议后，该公司可以继续推进在法国北部杰罗姆港炼油厂的裁员计划。【原文：Energy major Exxon Mobil can move ahead with a plan to cut jobs at its Port Jerome refinery in northern France after obtaining a majority agreement this week with unions, a company spokesperson said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国参议员沃伦要求监管机构对花旗施加增长限制
item.description: 一位著名的美国民主党参议员周三呼吁最高监管机构对花旗集团实施增长限制，因为这家华尔街银行正在努力解决持续存在的监管问题。【原文：A prominent Democratic U.S. senator called on a top regulator on Wednesday to impose growth restrictions on Citigroup as the Wall Street bank struggles to fix ongoing regulatory problems.】

item.title: 美国向 EVgo 提供 10.5 亿美元有条件贷款用于电动汽车充电站建设
item.description: 美国周四向电动汽车公司（EVgo）提供了高达 10.5 亿美元的有条件贷款担保，用于在全国范围内扩建公共电动汽车充电基础设施，其中一些设施位于城市边缘社区。【原文：The United States on Thursday offered EVgo a conditional loan guarantee of up to $1.05 billion to expand public electric vehicle-charging infrastructure across the country, some of which in marginalized urban communities.】

item.title: 市场与中东：投资者如何经受地缘政治的考验
item.description: 中东冲突再次升级，但由于石油生产的变化以及全球降息使地缘政治黯然失色，整个金融市场的情绪目前仍然乐观。【原文：Conflict in the Middle East is escalating once more, but the mood music across financial markets remains upbeat for now due to shifts in oil production and as global interest rate cuts eclipse geopolitics.】

item.title: 招聘公司 Challenger 称，9 月份美国计划裁员人数下降
item.description: 周四发布的月度裁员公告统计显示，9月份美国的裁员公告从8月份的五个月高点下滑，但今年迄今为止的裁员速度已超过去年。【原文：U.S. layoff announcements slipped in September from August's five-month high but for the year to date have now edged past last year's pace, a monthly tally of workforce reduction announcements showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 亚马逊计划为假期招聘 25 万名员工，与去年持平
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon）周四表示，由于预计2024年最后一个季度的电子商务支出将超过整体假日销售额，该公司计划在这个假日购物季招聘25万名运输和仓库工人，人数与去年持平。【原文：Amazon plans to hire 250,000 transportation and warehouse workers this holiday shopping season, the same number as last year as e-commerce spending is expected to outpace overall holiday sales in the final quarter of 2024, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 投资者质疑股息，Stellantis 股价跌至逾两年低点
item.description: 在本周早些时候发布利润预警后，Stellantis 的股价在周四进一步下跌，原因是人们对该汽车制造商股息的可持续性感到担忧。【原文：Stellantis shares fell further on Thursday amid concerns over the sustainability of the automaker's dividend following a profit warning earlier this week.】

item.title: 投资者等待劳动力数据，评估中东风险，期货下跌
item.description: 美国股指期货周四下滑，市场在等待有关经济前景和美联储进一步降息可能性的数据，同时关注中东敌对行动的潜在升级。【原文：U.S. stock index futures slipped on Thursday as markets awaited data for insights on the economic outlook and the likelihood of further interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve, while watching for a potential escalation in Middle East hostilities.】

item.title: 海伦飓风暴露了联邦紧急事务管理局在阿巴拉契亚地区的援助缺口
item.description: 随着北卡罗来纳州西部居民的生活逐渐恢复正常，能够依靠联邦洪水保险的居民将寥寥无几。【原文：As residents of western North Carolina piece together their lives, few will be able to rely on federal flood insurance.】

item.title: 美国写字楼市场在大幅打折促销后出现触底迹象
item.description: 分析师告诉路透社记者，陷入困境的美国办公物业市场可能正在触底反弹，他们指出，在过去一个季度里，一连串受压物业以大幅折扣出售，帮助确立了新的定价基准。【原文：The beleaguered U.S. office property market may be bottoming out, analysts told Reuters, pointing to a string of sales of stressed properties at big discounts over the last quarter that have helped set a new pricing benchmark.】

item.title: 早间竞价：欧洲和日本鹰派联合造势，美元大涨
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: Uber 和 Lyft 司机将特斯拉用作临时机器人出租车，引发安全担忧
item.description: 今年 4 月，一辆为优步（Uber）服务的自动驾驶特斯拉汽车在拉斯维加斯郊区的一个十字路口撞上了一辆 SUV，这起事故引发了新的担忧，即越来越多的自称 "机器人出租车 "正在利用美国城市的监管灰色地带，危及生命安全。【原文：A self-driving Tesla carrying a passenger for Uber rammed into an SUV at an intersection in suburban Las Vegas in April, an accident that sparked new concerns that a growing stable of self-styled "robotaxis" is exploiting a regulatory gray area in U.S. cities, putting lives at risk.】
